Self.Wiki: Determines the parameters relating to lock-on camera configurations, and the default camera.

camDistTarget.Wiki: The distance the camera is placed from the current target. In metres.

rotRangeMinX.Wiki: The minimum rotational value on the X-axis for the camera. In degrees.

lockRotXShiftRatio_Base.Wiki: The standard value of rotation * rotation shift rate. 0.0 is the centre of screen, 1.0 is the top, -1.0 is the bottom.

chrOrgOffset_Y.Wiki: The height of the camera's look point (from the character's root position, when touching the ground). In metres.

chrLockRangeMaxRadius.Wiki: The maximum radius from the character's root position that the camera can be locked-on to.

camFovY.Wiki: The vertical field of view to apply when active to the camera.

chrTransChaseRateForNormalX.Wiki: The character tracking rate for left and right motion, applied to the camera.

chrTransChaseRateForNormalU.Wiki: The character tracking rate for up and down motion, applied to the camera.

chrTransChaseRateForNormalF.Wiki: The character tracking rate for forward motion, applied to the camera.

chrTransChaseRateForNormalB.Wiki: The character tracking rate for backward motion, applied to the camera.

lockRotXShiftRatio_LerpRate.AltName: Lock-on - Rotation: Interpolation for Shift Ratio
lockRotXShiftRatio_LerpRate.Wiki: The interpolation rate for the 'Rotation: Shift Ratio' field, independant of distance.

shoulderOverDeg.Wiki: If not 0, then an over-the-shoulder perspective is applied. If positive, the character is to the left, if negative, to the right.

lockCamParamLerpRate.Wiki: The interpolation rate for the lock-camera parameters.

shoulderOverChangeDirectionMethod.Wiki: The turning method applied for the over-the-shoulder perspective.

shoulderOverChangeDirectionSpeed.Wiki: The turning speed for the over-the-shoulder perspective, if the method is 'Press and Hold (Angle)'

shoulderOverChangeDirectionTimeThreshold.Wiki: The turning time threshold for the over-the-shoulder perspective, if the method is 'Press and Hold (Time)'

shoulderOverChangeDirectionLerpRate.Wiki: The turning interpolation rate for the over-the-shoulder perspective.

chrTransChaseRateParam_AccelMaxX.Wiki: The maximum acceleration rate when tracking a character on the horizontal (X-axis) plane. In metres per second ^ 2.

chrTransChaseRateParam_ChaseRateDecrease.Wiki: The maximum deceleration if tracking a character on the horizontal (X-axis) plane, after having reached acceleration maximum. In metres per second ^ 2.

chrTransChaseRateForNormalX_LerpRate.Wiki: The interpolation rate for tracking a character on the horizontal (X-axis) plane.

shoulderOverChangeDirectionShortTimeThre.Wiki: The turning time threshold for the over-the-shoulder perspective, if the method is 'Play Short'. Do not set below 1 frame.

chrTransChaseRateParam_AccelMaxY.Wiki: The maximum acceleration rate when tracking a character on the vertical (Y-axis) plane. In metres per second ^ 2.

chrTransChaseRateParam_ChaseRateDecrease.Wiki: The maximum deceleration if tracking a character on the vertical (Y-axis) plane, after having reached acceleration maximum. In metres per second ^ 2.

chrTransChaseRateForNormalY_LerpRate.Wiki: The interpolation rate for tracking a character on the vertical (Y-axis) plane.

shoulderOverChangeDirectionMinAngleThres.AltName: Over-the-Shoulder: Minimum Rotation Input Threshold (Play Short)
shoulderOverChangeDirectionMinAngleThres.Wiki: The minimum rotation input threshold for the over-the-shoulder perspective, if the method is 'Play Short'. In radians.

lockRotChaseRate.Wiki: The tracking rate when the camera is locked-on to another character.

rotSpeed_Min_X.Wiki: The minimum rotation speed on the X-axis. In degrees per second.

rotSpeed_Max_X.Wiki: The maximum rotation speed on the X-axis. In degrees per second.

rotHiSpeed_Min_X.Wiki: The minimum rotation speed on the X-axis in the high-speed state. In degrees per second.

rotHiSpeed_Max_X.Wiki: The maximum rotation speed on the X-axis in the high-speed state. In degrees per second.

priority.Wiki: The priority at which this parameter is applied. If the priority is the same as another, the ordering is handled internally.

doInverseTurnDirection.Wiki: If ON, when the character is on the left-hand side of the screen, and turns to the right, the over-the-shoulder perspective will switch, and vice versa.

doUseOverShoulderViewWhenLockOn.Wiki: If ON, then the over-the-shoulder perspective will apply whilst locked-on.

doUseOverShoulderViewWhenNotLockOn.Wiki: If ON, then the over-the-shoulder perspective will apply whilst not locked-on.

doIgnoreOptionRotSpeedRate.Wiki: If ON, optional rotation speed rate is ignored (if ignored, the value used is 5).

locksiteMoveFactor.Wiki: The factor to use with the movement speed value for the lock reticule when moving.

rotRangeMaxX.Wiki: The maximum rotational value on the X-axis for the camera. In degrees.

rotRangeMinY.Wiki: The minimum rotational value on the Y-axis for the camera. In degrees.

rotRangeMaxY.Wiki: The maximum rotational value on the Y-axis for the camera. In degrees.

chrTransChaseRateForNormalD.Wiki: The character tracking rate for down motion, applied to the camera.

lockRotXShiftRatio_Min.Wiki: The minimum value of rotation * rotation shift rate. 0.0 is the centre of screen, 1.0 is the top, -1.0 is the bottom.

lockRotXShiftRatio_Max.Wiki: The maximum value of rotation * rotation shift rate. 0.0 is the centre of screen, 1.0 is the top, -1.0 is the bottom.

lockRotXShiftRatio_LerpMinDist.AltName: Lock-on - Rotation: Shift Ratio - Interpolation Minimum Distance
lockRotXShiftRatio_LerpMinDist.Wiki: The minimum distance for the interpolation of the rotation * rotation shift rate.

lockRotXShiftRatio_LerpMidMinDist.AltName: Lock-on - Rotation: Shift Ratio - Interpolation Middle-Minimum Distance
lockRotXShiftRatio_LerpMidMinDist.Wiki: The middle-minimum distance for the interpolation of the rotation * rotation shift rate.

lockRotXShiftRatio_LerpMidMaxDist.AltName: Lock-on - Rotation: Shift Ratio - Interpolation Middle-Maximum Distance
lockRotXShiftRatio_LerpMidMaxDist.Wiki: The middle-maximum distance for the interpolation of the rotation * rotation shift rate.

lockRotXShiftRatio_LerpMaxDist.AltName: Lock-on - Rotation: Shift Ratio - Interpolation Maximum Distance
lockRotXShiftRatio_LerpMaxDist.Wiki: The maximum distance for the interpolation of the rotation * rotation shift rate.

chrTransChaseRateParam_ChaseRateDecrease.AltName: Character: Maximum Horizontal Tracking Reduction from Speed
chrTransChaseRateParam_ChaseRateDecrease.Wiki: The maximum amount of horizontal tracking reduction due to the speed of the character.

chrTransChaseRateParam_MaxHorizontalSpee.Wiki: The horizontal speed at which the horizontal tracking rate is the lowest. In metres per second.

chrTransChaseRateParam_ChaseRateDecrease.AltName: Character: Maximum Horizontal Tracking Reduction from Speed (Front)
chrTransChaseRateParam_ChaseRateDecrease.Wiki: The maximum amount of horizontal (front) tracking reduction due to the speed of the character.

chrTransChaseRateParam_ChaseRateDecrease.AltName: Character: Maximum Horizontal Tracking Reduction from Speed (Back)
chrTransChaseRateParam_ChaseRateDecrease.Wiki: The maximum amount of horizontal (Back) tracking reduction due to the speed of the character.

closeToTargetDistance.Wiki: The minimum distance away from a target that the camera is able to lock-on to them. In metres.

overShoulderRadLerpRate.Wiki: The interpolation rate for the over-the-shoulder turning. In radians.

overShoulderRadLerpRateWhenLockOnOff.Wiki: The interpolation rate for the over-the-shoulder turning when unlocked. In radians.

overShoulderRadLerpRateLerpRate.Wiki: The interpolation of the interpolation rate for the over-the-shoulder turning. In radians.

chrTransChaseRateForQBX.Wiki: The horizontal tracking rate during quick-boost of characters.

chrTransChaseRateForQBF.Wiki: The forward tracking rate during quick-boost of characters.

chrTransChaseRateForQBB.Wiki: The backward tracking rate during quick-boost of characters.

chrTransChaseRateForBoostX.Wiki: The horizontal tracking value during quick-boost of characters.

chrTransChaseRateForBoostF.Wiki: The forward tracking value during quick-boost of characters.

chrTransChaseRateForBoostB.Wiki: The backward tracking value during quick-boost of characters.

chrTransChaseRateForNormalF_LerpRate.AltName: Quick Boost: Interpolation % of Forward Tracking
chrTransChaseRateForNormalF_LerpRate.Wiki: The interpolation rate of the forward tracking rate during quick-boost.

chrTransChaseRateForNormalB_LerpRate.AltName: Quick Boost: Interpolation % of Backward Tracking
chrTransChaseRateForNormalB_LerpRate.Wiki: The interpolation rate of the backward tracking rate during quick-boost.

shootTargetLookUpAngAtUnlock.Wiki: The angle at which the camera looks when it is a free camera (whilst unlocked).

shootTargetLookUpAngAtLock.Wiki: The angle at which the camera looks when it is a free camera (whilst locked).

lockRotChasePlayAngHorizontal.Wiki: The horizontal tracking rotation angle to use during lock-on. In degrees.

camLookupOffsetY.Wiki: The offset to apply to the upwards camera look on the Y-axis. In metres.

camLookupOffsetZ.Wiki: The offset to apply to the upwards camera look on the Z-axis. In metres.

camLookdownOffsetY.Wiki: The offset to apply to the downwards camera look on the Y-axis. In metres.

camLookdownOffsetZ.Wiki: The offset to apply to the downwards camera look on the Z-axis. In metres.

lockRotChaseRateRecoverRateAfterCrossing.Wiki: The higher the value, the faster the camera will rotate towards the target after moving pass them.

crossingLockRotChaseRate.Wiki: The lock-on rotation tracking rate to apply after moving pass the target. The smaller the value, the more linear our movement will be.

crossingLastTime.Wiki: The duration of the passing moment, the moment we pass our target.

crossingHorizontalDistanceThreshold.Wiki: The horziontal distance threshold to trigger the passing state between us and our target. In metres.

crossingRelativeVelocityThreshold.Wiki: The relative velocity required to 'pass' our target. The horizontal velocity between us and our target must be above this threshold.

lockRotChasePlayAngVertical.Wiki: The vertical tracking rotation angle to use during lock-on. In degrees.

lockRotChasePlayAngHorizontalReturnLerpR.Wiki: The interpolation rate when the target returns to the centre of the screen from a horizontal angle.

lockRotChasePlayAngVerticalReturnLerpRat.Wiki: The interpolation rate when the target returns to the centre of the screen from a vertical angle.

camAutoPullWhenLookUpRotXThreshold.AltName: Automatic Camera Pull: X-Axis Rotation Threshold
camAutoPullWhenLookUpRotXThreshold.Wiki: Applies when the camera looks up. The angle on the X-axis at which the threshold for the automatic camera pulling occurs. -1 means it will trigger if the camera descends to the character's root position. Set to 90 to disable the pulling.

camAutoPullWhenLookUpWeight.Wiki: Applies when the camera looks up. The higher the weight, the lower the rotation. Higher values mean the view is pulled closer to the character, away from the target.

camAutoPullWhenLookUpCamDistWeight.Wiki: Applies when the camera looks up. The magnification rate to apply to the automatic camera pulling.

camAutoPullWhenLookUpCamDistMax.Wiki: Applies when the camera looks up. The maximum distance for the automatic camera pulling.

chrOrgOffset_Y_Up.Wiki: The height of the camera's look point (from the character's root position, whilst ascending). In metres.

chrOrgOffset_Y_Down.Wiki: The height of the camera's look point (from the character's root position, whilst descending). In metres.

chrOrgOffset_Y_LerpRate.Wiki: The interpolation rate for the character height offset.

chrOrgOffset_Y_MuteAirLerpRate.AltName: Character: Height Offset Interpolation % (Disable Camera Aerial Offset)
chrOrgOffset_Y_MuteAirLerpRate.Wiki: The interpolation rate for the character height offset, after the 'Disable camera aerial offset (for PC)' event has been triggered via TAE.

playerFadeDist.Wiki: The distance between the camera and the character at which the dither fade starts.

rotSpeed_Min_Y.Wiki: The minimum rotation speed on the Y-axis. In degrees per second.

rotSpeed_Max_Y.Wiki: The maximum rotation speed on the Y-axis. In degrees per second.

rotHiSpeed_Min_Y.Wiki: The minimum rotation high-speed on the Y-axis. In degrees per second.

rotHiSpeed_Max_Y.Wiki: The maximum rotation high-speed on the Y-axis. In degrees per second.
